unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi saw a 20% spike in gastroenterology-related OPD cases post-Diwali! Apparently, all those extra mithais, samosas, and pakoras took their toll. Dr. Sharma quipped, "Seems like everyone preponed their appointment to see me, thanks to the 'Festival of Overeating'!"
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi saw a twenty percent spike in gastroenterology-related O-P-D cases post-Diwali! Apparently, all those extra mithais, samosas, and pakoras took their toll. Doctor Sharma quipped, "Seems like everyone preponed their appointment to see me, thanks to the 'Festival of Overeating'!"

unnormalised: The most common complaint? Acidity, followed by indigestion and, believe it or not, constipation. One patient, Mr. Kumar from Gurgaon, joked that his stomach was staging a protest after being subjected to 10 gulab jamuns in one sitting.
normalised: The most common complaint? Acidity, followed by indigestion and, believe it or not, constipation. One patient, Mister Kumar from Gurgaon, joked that his stomach was staging a protest after being subjected to ten gulab jamuns in one sitting.

unnormalised: Doctors are prescribing the usual: antacids, pro-biotics, and a hefty dose of "control yourself next time." Also, apparently, some patients tried self-medicating with old wives' tales (like drinking ajwain water), which… well, let’s just say it didn't always go as planned.
normalised: Doctors are prescribing the usual: antacids, pro-biotics, and a hefty dose of "control yourself next time." Also, apparently, some patients tried self-medicating with old wives' tales (like drinking ajwain water), which… well, let’s just say it didn't always go as planned.

unnormalised: Hospital staff has started affectionately referring to this period as "Gastro-geddon." Maybe next year, a public health campaign to promote "Mindful Mithai Consumption" is in order? Who knows, it might just save a few trips to the gastroenterologist.
normalised: Hospital staff has started affectionately referring to this period as "Gastro-geddon." Maybe next year, a public health campaign to promote "Mindful Mithai Consumption" is in order? Who knows, it might just save a few trips to the gastroenterologist.

unnormalised: So, remember folks, while Diwali is the festival of lights and joy, it's also a reminder that your digestive system has its limits. Maybe stick to 5 gulab jamuns next year, eh? Dr. Singh says your stomach will thank you for it. He even printed out t-shirts saying so!
normalised: So, remember folks, while Diwali is the festival of lights and joy, it's also a reminder that your digestive system has its limits. Maybe stick to five gulab jamuns next year, eh? Doctor Singh says your stomach will thank you for it. He even printed out t-shirts saying so!
